title: Downloading block bodies times out after 100 seconds and restarts
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon/v2.47.0-stable-5536d645/linux-amd64/go1.20.5

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash: 5536d645

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
--authrpc.jwtsecret=/jwt.hex
--authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0
--authrpc.vhosts=*
--ws
--datadir=/erigon-data
--prune=htc
--maxpeers=10

Concensus Layer: Nimbus

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):
      --el="ws://erigon:8551"
      --el="ws://geth:8551"
      --jwt-secret=/home/user/nimbus-eth2/build/data/jwt.hex
      --data-dir=/home/user/nimbus-eth2/build/data
      --enr-auto-update:true
      --num-threads=4
      --rest
      --rest-address=0.0.0.0
      --rest-allow-origin=*
      --metrics
      --metrics-address="0.0.0.0"
      --doppelganger-detection=false
      --status-bar=false
      --max-peers=30

Chain/Network: Ethereum mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon should wait until all block bodies have been downloaded 

#### Actual behaviour
Erigon downloads block headers, but if not all have been delivered after 100 seconds it will restart from scratch. This process has been running for quite a while now.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Start Erigon after some downtime, so that the number of missing blocks is too high and they cannot be downloaded within 100 seconds

[erigon-logs.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/11834046/erigon-logs.txt)
